00035 struct card_atqa {
00036   uint16_t atqa;
00037   uint16_t mask;
00038   char type[128];
00039   // list of up to 8 SAK values compatible with this ATQA
00040   int saklist[8];
00041 };
00042 
00043 struct card_sak {
00044   uint8_t sak;
00045   uint8_t mask;
00046   char type[128];
00047 };
00048

00108 struct card_sak const_cs[] = {
00109   {0x00, 0xff, "" },                      // 00 MIFARE Ultralight / Ultralight C
00110   {0x09, 0xff, "" },                      // 01 MIFARE Mini 0.3K
00111   {0x08, 0xff, "" },                      // 02 MIFARE Classic 1K
00112   {0x18, 0xff, "" },                      // 03 MIFARE Classik 4K
00113   {0x08, 0xff, " 2K, Security level 1" }, // 04 MIFARE Plus
00114   {0x18, 0xff, " 4K, Security level 1" }, // 05 MIFARE Plus
00115   {0x10, 0xff, " 2K, Security level 2" }, // 06 MIFARE Plus
00116   {0x11, 0xff, " 4K, Security level 2" }, // 07 MIFARE Plus
00117   {0x20, 0xff, " 2K, Security level 3" }, // 08 MIFARE Plus
00118   {0x20, 0xff, " 4K, Security level 3" }, // 09 MIFARE Plus
00119   {0x20, 0xff, " 4K" },                   // 10 MIFARE DESFire
00120   {0x20, 0xff, " EV1 2K/4K/8K" },         // 11 MIFARE DESFire
00121   {0x00, 0x00, "" },                      // 12 SmartMX
00122 };

00124 int
00125 snprint_hex(char *dst, size_t size, const uint8_t *pbtData, const size_t szBytes)
00126 {
00127   size_t  szPos;
00128   size_t res = 0;
00129   for (szPos = 0; szPos < szBytes; szPos++) {
00130     res += snprintf(dst + res, size - res, "%02x  ", pbtData[szPos]);
00131   }
00132   res += snprintf(dst + res, size - res, "\n");
00133   return res;
00134 }
00135 
00136 #define SAK_UID_NOT_COMPLETE     0x04
00137 #define SAK_ISO14443_4_COMPLIANT 0x20
00138 #define SAK_ISO18092_COMPLIANT   0x40
00139 
00140 void
00141 snprint_nfc_iso14443a_info(char *dst, size_t size, const nfc_iso14443a_info *pnai, bool verbose)
00142 {
00143   int off = 0;
00144   off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "    ATQA (SENS_RES): ");
00145   off += snprint_hex(dst + off, size - off, pnai->abtAtqa, 2);
00146   if (verbose) {
00147     off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* UID size: ");
00148     switch ((pnai->abtAtqa[1] & 0xc0) >> 6) {
00149       case 0:
00150         off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "single\n");
00151         break;
00152       case 1:
00153         off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "double\n");
00154         break;
00155       case 2:
00156         off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "triple\n");
00157         break;
00158       case 3:
00159         off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "RFU\n");
00160         break;
00161     }
00162     off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* bit frame anticollision ");
00163     switch (pnai->abtAtqa[1] & 0x1f) {
00164       case 0x01:
00165       case 0x02:
00166       case 0x04:
00167       case 0x08:
00168       case 0x10:
00169         off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "supported\n");
00170         break;
00171       default:
00172         off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "not supported\n");
00173         break;
00174     }
00175   }
00176   off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "       UID (NFCID%c): ", (pnai->abtUid[0] == 0x08 ? '3' : '1'));
00177   off += snprint_hex(dst + off, size - off, pnai->abtUid, pnai->szUidLen);
00178   if (verbose) {
00179     if (pnai->abtUid[0] == 0x08) {
00180       off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* Random UID\n");
00181     }
00182   }
00183   off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "      SAK (SEL_RES): ");
00184   off += snprint_hex(dst + off, size - off, &pnai->btSak, 1);
00185   if (verbose) {
00186     if (pnai->btSak & SAK_UID_NOT_COMPLETE) {
00187       off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* Warning! Cascade bit set: UID not complete\n");
00188     }
00189     if (pnai->btSak & SAK_ISO14443_4_COMPLIANT) {
00190       off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* Compliant with ISO/IEC 14443-4\n");
00191     } else {
00192       off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* Not compliant with ISO/IEC 14443-4\n");
00193     }
00194     if (pnai->btSak & SAK_ISO18092_COMPLIANT) {
00195       off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* Compliant with ISO/IEC 18092\n");
00196     } else {
00197       off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* Not compliant with ISO/IEC 18092\n");
00198     }
00199   }
00200   if (pnai->szAtsLen) {
00201     off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "                ATS: ");
00202     off += snprint_hex(dst + off, size - off, pnai->abtAts, pnai->szAtsLen);
00203   }
00204   if (pnai->szAtsLen && verbose) {
00205     // Decode ATS according to ISO/IEC 14443-4 (5.2 Answer to select)
00206     const int iMaxFrameSizes[] = { 16, 24, 32, 40, 48, 64, 96, 128, 256 };
00207     off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* Max Frame Size accepted by PICC: %d bytes\n", iMaxFrameSizes[pnai->abtAts[0] & 0x0F]);
00208 
00209     size_t offset = 1;
00210     if (pnai->abtAts[0] & 0x10) { // TA(1) present
00211       uint8_t TA = pnai->abtAts[offset];
00212       offset++;
00213       off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* Bit Rate Capability:\n");
00214       if (TA == 0) {
00215         off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "  * PICC supports only 106 kbits/s in both directions\n");
00216       }
00217       if (TA & 1 << 7) {
00218         off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "  * Same bitrate in both directions mandatory\n");
00219       }
00220       if (TA & 1 << 4) {
00221         off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "  * PICC to PCD, DS=2, bitrate 212 kbits/s supported\n");
00222       }
00223       if (TA & 1 << 5) {
00224         off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "  * PICC to PCD, DS=4, bitrate 424 kbits/s supported\n");
00225       }
00226       if (TA & 1 << 6) {
00227         off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "  * PICC to PCD, DS=8, bitrate 847 kbits/s supported\n");
00228       }
00229       if (TA & 1 << 0) {
00230         off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "  * PCD to PICC, DR=2, bitrate 212 kbits/s supported\n");
00231       }
00232       if (TA & 1 << 1) {
00233         off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "  * PCD to PICC, DR=4, bitrate 424 kbits/s supported\n");
00234       }
00235       if (TA & 1 << 2) {
00236         off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "  * PCD to PICC, DR=8, bitrate 847 kbits/s supported\n");
00237       }
00238       if (TA & 1 << 3) {
00239         off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "  * ERROR unknown value\n");
00240       }
00241     }
00242     if (pnai->abtAts[0] & 0x20) { // TB(1) present
00243       uint8_t TB = pnai->abtAts[offset];
00244       offset++;
00245       off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* Frame Waiting Time: %.4g ms\n", 256.0 * 16.0 * (1 << ((TB & 0xf0) >> 4)) / 13560.0);
00246       if ((TB & 0x0f) == 0) {
00247         off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* No Start-up Frame Guard Time required\n");
00248       } else {
00249         off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* Start-up Frame Guard Time: %.4g ms\n", 256.0 * 16.0 * (1 << (TB & 0x0f)) / 13560.0);
00250       }
00251     }
00252     if (pnai->abtAts[0] & 0x40) { // TC(1) present
00253       uint8_t TC = pnai->abtAts[offset];
00254       offset++;
00255       if (TC & 0x1) {
00256         off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* Node Address supported\n");
00257       } else {
00258         off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* Node Address not supported\n");
00259       }
00260       if (TC & 0x2) {
00261         off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* Card IDentifier supported\n");
00262       } else {
00263         off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* Card IDentifier not supported\n");
00264       }
00265     }
00266     if (pnai->szAtsLen > offset) {
00267       off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* Historical bytes Tk: ");
00268       off += snprint_hex(dst + off, size - off, pnai->abtAts + offset, (pnai->szAtsLen - offset));
00269       uint8_t CIB = pnai->abtAts[offset];
00270       offset++;
00271       if (CIB != 0x00 && CIB != 0x10 && (CIB & 0xf0) != 0x80) {
00272         off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "  * Proprietary format\n");
00273         if (CIB == 0xc1) {
00274           off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "    * Tag byte: Mifare or virtual cards of various types\n");
00275           uint8_t L = pnai->abtAts[offset];
00276           offset++;
00277           if (L != (pnai->szAtsLen - offset)) {
00278             off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "    * Warning: Type Identification Coding length (%i)", L);
00279             off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, " not matching Tk length (%" PRIdPTR ")\n", (pnai->szAtsLen - offset));
00280           }
00281           if ((pnai->szAtsLen - offset - 2) > 0) { // Omit 2 CRC bytes
00282             uint8_t CTC = pnai->abtAts[offset];
00283             offset++;
00284             off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "    * Chip Type: ");
00285             switch (CTC & 0xf0) {
00286               case 0x00:
00287                 off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "(Multiple) Virtual Cards\n");
00288                 break;
00289               case 0x10:
00290                 off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "Mifare DESFire\n");
00291                 break;
00292               case 0x20:
00293                 off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "Mifare Plus\n");
00294                 break;
00295               default:
00296                 off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "RFU\n");
00297                 break;
00298             }
00299             off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "    * Memory size: ");
00300             switch (CTC & 0x0f) {
00301               case 0x00:
00302                 off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "<1 kbyte\n");
00303                 break;
00304               case 0x01:
00305                 off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "1 kbyte\n");
00306                 break;
00307               case 0x02:
00308                 off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "2 kbyte\n");
00309                 break;
00310               case 0x03:
00311                 off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "4 kbyte\n");
00312                 break;
00313               case 0x04:
00314                 off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "8 kbyte\n");
00315                 break;
00316               case 0x0f:
00317                 off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "Unspecified\n");
00318                 break;
00319               default:
00320                 off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "RFU\n");
00321                 break;
00322             }
00323           }
00324           if ((pnai->szAtsLen - offset) > 0) { // Omit 2 CRC bytes
00325             uint8_t CVC = pnai->abtAts[offset];
00326             offset++;
00327             off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "    * Chip Status: ");
00328             switch (CVC & 0xf0) {
00329               case 0x00:
00330                 off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "Engineering sample\n");
00331                 break;
00332               case 0x20:
00333                 off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "Released\n");
00334                 break;
00335               default:
00336                 off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "RFU\n");
00337                 break;
00338             }
00339             off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "    * Chip Generation: ");
00340             switch (CVC & 0x0f) {
00341               case 0x00:
00342                 off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "Generation 1\n");
00343                 break;
00344               case 0x01:
00345                 off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "Generation 2\n");
00346                 break;
00347               case 0x02:
00348                 off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "Generation 3\n");
00349                 break;
00350               case 0x0f:
00351                 off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "Unspecified\n");
00352                 break;
00353               default:
00354                 off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "RFU\n");
00355                 break;
00356             }
00357           }
00358           if ((pnai->szAtsLen - offset) > 0) { // Omit 2 CRC bytes
00359             uint8_t VCS = pnai->abtAts[offset];
00360             offset++;
00361             off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "    * Specifics (Virtual Card Selection):\n");
00362             if ((VCS & 0x09) == 0x00) {
00363               off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "      * Only VCSL supported\n");
00364             } else if ((VCS & 0x09) == 0x01) {
00365               off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "      * VCS, VCSL and SVC supported\n");
00366             }
00367             if ((VCS & 0x0e) == 0x00) {
00368               off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "      * SL1, SL2(?), SL3 supported\n");
00369             } else if ((VCS & 0x0e) == 0x02) {
00370               off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "      * SL3 only card\n");
00371             } else if ((VCS & 0x0f) == 0x0e) {
00372               off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "      * No VCS command supported\n");
00373             } else if ((VCS & 0x0f) == 0x0f) {
00374               off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "      * Unspecified\n");
00375             } else {
00376               off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "      * RFU\n");
00377             }
00378           }
00379         }
00380       } else {
00381         if (CIB == 0x00) {
00382           off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "  * Tk after 0x00 consist of optional consecutive COMPACT-TLV data objects\n");
00383           off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "    followed by a mandatory status indicator (the last three bytes, not in TLV)\n");
00384           off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "    See ISO/IEC 7816-4 8.1.1.3 for more info\n");
00385         }
00386         if (CIB == 0x10) {
00387           off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "  * DIR data reference: %02x\n", pnai->abtAts[offset]);
00388         }
00389         if (CIB == 0x80) {
00390           if (pnai->szAtsLen == offset) {
00391             off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "  * No COMPACT-TLV objects found, no status found\n");
00392           } else {
00393             off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "  * Tk after 0x80 consist of optional consecutive COMPACT-TLV data objects;\n");
00394             off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "    the last data object may carry a status indicator of one, two or three bytes.\n");
00395             off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "    See ISO/IEC 7816-4 8.1.1.3 for more info\n");
00396           }
00397         }
00398       }
00399     }
00400   }
00401   if (verbose) {
00402     off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "\nFingerprinting based on MIFARE type Identification Procedure:\n"); // AN10833
00403     uint16_t atqa = 0;
00404     uint8_t sak = 0;
00405     uint8_t i, j;
00406     bool found_possible_match = false;
00407 
00408     atqa = (((uint16_t)pnai->abtAtqa[0] & 0xff) << 8);
00409     atqa += (((uint16_t)pnai->abtAtqa[1] & 0xff));
00410     sak = ((uint8_t)pnai->btSak & 0xff);
00411 
00412     for (i = 0; i < sizeof(const_ca) / sizeof(const_ca[0]); i++) {
00413       if ((atqa & const_ca[i].mask) == const_ca[i].atqa) {
00414         for (j = 0; (j < sizeof(const_ca[i].saklist)) && (const_ca[i].saklist[j] >= 0); j++) {
00415           int sakindex = const_ca[i].saklist[j];
00416           if ((sak & const_cs[sakindex].mask) == const_cs[sakindex].sak) {
00417             off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* %s%s\n", const_ca[i].type, const_cs[sakindex].type);
00418             found_possible_match = true;
00419           }
00420         }
00421       }
00422     }
00423     // Other matches not described in
00424     // AN10833 MIFARE Type Identification Procedure
00425     // but seen in the field:
00426     off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "Other possible matches based on ATQA & SAK values:\n");
00427     uint32_t atqasak = 0;
00428     atqasak += (((uint32_t)pnai->abtAtqa[0] & 0xff) << 16);
00429     atqasak += (((uint32_t)pnai->abtAtqa[1] & 0xff) << 8);
00430     atqasak += ((uint32_t)pnai->btSak & 0xff);
00431     switch (atqasak) {
00432       case 0x000488:
00433         off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* Mifare Classic 1K Infineon\n");
00434         found_possible_match = true;
00435         break;
00436       case 0x000298:
00437         off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* Gemplus MPCOS\n");
00438         found_possible_match = true;
00439         break;
00440       case 0x030428:
00441         off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* JCOP31\n");
00442         found_possible_match = true;
00443         break;
00444       case 0x004820:
00445         off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* JCOP31 v2.4.1\n");
00446         off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* JCOP31 v2.2\n");
00447         found_possible_match = true;
00448         break;
00449       case 0x000428:
00450         off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* JCOP31 v2.3.1\n");
00451         found_possible_match = true;
00452         break;
00453       case 0x000453:
00454         off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* Fudan FM1208SH01\n");
00455         found_possible_match = true;
00456         break;
00457       case 0x000820:
00458         off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* Fudan FM1208\n");
00459         found_possible_match = true;
00460         break;
00461       case 0x000238:
00462         off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* MFC 4K emulated by Nokia 6212 Classic\n");
00463         found_possible_match = true;
00464         break;
00465       case 0x000838:
00466         off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* MFC 4K emulated by Nokia 6131 NFC\n");
00467         found_possible_match = true;
00468         break;
00469     }
00470     if (! found_possible_match) {
00471       snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* Unknown card, sorry\n");
00472     }
00473   }
00474 }
00475 
00476 void
00477 snprint_nfc_felica_info(char *dst, size_t size, const nfc_felica_info *pnfi, bool verbose)
00478 {
00479   (void) verbose;
00480   int off = 0;
00481   off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "        ID (NFCID2): ");
00482   off += snprint_hex(dst + off, size - off, pnfi->abtId, 8);
00483   off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "    Parameter (PAD): ");
00484   off += snprint_hex(dst + off, size - off, pnfi->abtPad, 8);
00485   off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "   System Code (SC): ");
00486   snprint_hex(dst + off, size - off, pnfi->abtSysCode, 2);
00487 }
00488 
00489 void
00490 snprint_nfc_jewel_info(char *dst, size_t size, const nfc_jewel_info *pnji, bool verbose)
00491 {
00492   (void) verbose;
00493   int off = 0;
00494   off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "    ATQA (SENS_RES): ");
00495   off += snprint_hex(dst + off, size - off, pnji->btSensRes, 2);
00496   off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "      4-LSB JEWELID: ");
00497   snprint_hex(dst + off, size - off, pnji->btId, 4);
00498 }
00499 
00500 #define PI_ISO14443_4_SUPPORTED 0x01
00501 #define PI_NAD_SUPPORTED        0x01
00502 #define PI_CID_SUPPORTED        0x02
00503 void
00504 snprint_nfc_iso14443b_info(char *dst, size_t size, const nfc_iso14443b_info *pnbi, bool verbose)
00505 {
00506   int off = 0;
00507   off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "               PUPI: ");
00508   off += snprint_hex(dst + off, size - off, pnbi->abtPupi, 4);
00509   off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "   Application Data: ");
00510   off += snprint_hex(dst + off, size - off, pnbi->abtApplicationData, 4);
00511   off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "      Protocol Info: ");
00512   off += snprint_hex(dst + off, size - off, pnbi->abtProtocolInfo, 3);
00513   if (verbose) {
00514     off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* Bit Rate Capability:\n");
00515     if (pnbi->abtProtocolInfo[0] == 0) {
00516       off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, " * PICC supports only 106 kbits/s in both directions\n");
00517     }
00518     if (pnbi->abtProtocolInfo[0] & 1 << 7) {
00519       off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, " * Same bitrate in both directions mandatory\n");
00520     }
00521     if (pnbi->abtProtocolInfo[0] & 1 << 4) {
00522       off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, " * PICC to PCD, 1etu=64/fc, bitrate 212 kbits/s supported\n");
00523     }
00524     if (pnbi->abtProtocolInfo[0] & 1 << 5) {
00525       off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, " * PICC to PCD, 1etu=32/fc, bitrate 424 kbits/s supported\n");
00526     }
00527     if (pnbi->abtProtocolInfo[0] & 1 << 6) {
00528       off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, " * PICC to PCD, 1etu=16/fc, bitrate 847 kbits/s supported\n");
00529     }
00530     if (pnbi->abtProtocolInfo[0] & 1 << 0) {
00531       off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, " * PCD to PICC, 1etu=64/fc, bitrate 212 kbits/s supported\n");
00532     }
00533     if (pnbi->abtProtocolInfo[0] & 1 << 1) {
00534       off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, " * PCD to PICC, 1etu=32/fc, bitrate 424 kbits/s supported\n");
00535     }
00536     if (pnbi->abtProtocolInfo[0] & 1 << 2) {
00537       off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, " * PCD to PICC, 1etu=16/fc, bitrate 847 kbits/s supported\n");
00538     }
00539     if (pnbi->abtProtocolInfo[0] & 1 << 3) {
00540       off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, " * ERROR unknown value\n");
00541     }
00542     if ((pnbi->abtProtocolInfo[1] & 0xf0) <= 0x80) {
00543       const int iMaxFrameSizes[] = { 16, 24, 32, 40, 48, 64, 96, 128, 256 };
00544       off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* Maximum frame sizes: %d bytes\n", iMaxFrameSizes[((pnbi->abtProtocolInfo[1] & 0xf0) >> 4)]);
00545     }
00546     if ((pnbi->abtProtocolInfo[1] & 0x0f) == PI_ISO14443_4_SUPPORTED) {
00547       off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* Protocol types supported: ISO/IEC 14443-4\n");
00548     }
00549     off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* Frame Waiting Time: %.4g ms\n", 256.0 * 16.0 * (1 << ((pnbi->abtProtocolInfo[2] & 0xf0) >> 4)) / 13560.0);
00550     if ((pnbi->abtProtocolInfo[2] & (PI_NAD_SUPPORTED | PI_CID_SUPPORTED)) != 0) {
00551       off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "* Frame options supported: ");
00552       if ((pnbi->abtProtocolInfo[2] & PI_NAD_SUPPORTED) != 0) off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "NAD ");
00553       if ((pnbi->abtProtocolInfo[2] & PI_CID_SUPPORTED) != 0) off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "CID ");
00554       snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "\n");
00555     }
00556   }
00557 }
00558 
00559 void
00560 snprint_nfc_iso14443bi_info(char *dst, size_t size, const nfc_iso14443bi_info *pnii, bool verbose)
00561 {
00562   int off = 0;
00563   off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "                DIV: ");
00564   off += snprint_hex(dst + off, size - off, pnii->abtDIV, 4);
00565   if (verbose) {
00566     int version = (pnii->btVerLog & 0x1e) >> 1;
00567     off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "   Software Version: ");
00568     if (version == 15) {
00569       off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "Undefined\n");
00570     } else {
00571       off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "%i\n", version);
00572     }
00573 
00574     if ((pnii->btVerLog & 0x80) && (pnii->btConfig & 0x80)) {
00575       off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "        Wait Enable: yes");
00576     }
00577   }
00578   if ((pnii->btVerLog & 0x80) && (pnii->btConfig & 0x40)) {
00579     off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "                ATS: ");
00580     snprint_hex(dst + off, size - off, pnii->abtAtr, pnii->szAtrLen);
00581   }
00582 }
00583 
00584 void
00585 snprint_nfc_iso14443b2sr_info(char *dst, size_t size, const nfc_iso14443b2sr_info *pnsi, bool verbose)
00586 {
00587   (void) verbose;
00588   int off = 0;
00589   off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "                UID: ");
00590   snprint_hex(dst + off, size - off, pnsi->abtUID, 8);
00591 }
00592 
00593 void
00594 snprint_nfc_iso14443b2ct_info(char *dst, size_t size, const nfc_iso14443b2ct_info *pnci, bool verbose)
00595 {
00596   (void) verbose;
00597   int off = 0;
00598   uint32_t uid;
00599   uid = (pnci->abtUID[3] << 24) + (pnci->abtUID[2] << 16) + (pnci->abtUID[1] << 8) + pnci->abtUID[0];
00600   off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "                UID: ");
00601   off += snprint_hex(dst + off, size - off, pnci->abtUID, sizeof(pnci->abtUID));
00602   off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "      UID (decimal): %010u\n", uid);
00603   off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "       Product Code: %02X\n", pnci->btProdCode);
00604   snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "           Fab Code: %02X\n", pnci->btFabCode);
00605 }
00606 
00607 void
00608 snprint_nfc_dep_info(char *dst, size_t size, const nfc_dep_info *pndi, bool verbose)
00609 {
00610   (void) verbose;
00611   int off = 0;
00612   off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "       NFCID3: ");
00613   off += snprint_hex(dst + off, size - off, pndi->abtNFCID3, 10);
00614   off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "           BS: %02x\n", pndi->btBS);
00615   off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "           BR: %02x\n", pndi->btBR);
00616   off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "           TO: %02x\n", pndi->btTO);
00617   off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "           PP: %02x\n", pndi->btPP);
00618   if (pndi->szGB) {
00619     off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "General Bytes: ");
00620     snprint_hex(dst + off, size - off, pndi->abtGB, pndi->szGB);
00621   }
00622 }
00623 
00624 void
00625 snprint_nfc_target(char *dst, size_t size, const nfc_target *pnt, bool verbose)
00626 {
00627   if (NULL != pnt) {
00628     int off = 0;
00629     off += snprintf(dst + off, size - off, "%s (%s%s) target:\n", str_nfc_modulation_type(pnt->nm.nmt), str_nfc_baud_rate(pnt->nm.nbr), (pnt->nm.nmt != NMT_DEP) ? "" : (pnt->nti.ndi.ndm == NDM_ACTIVE) ? "active mode" : "passive mode");
00630     switch (pnt->nm.nmt) {
00631       case NMT_ISO14443A:
00632         snprint_nfc_iso14443a_info(dst + off, size - off, &pnt->nti.nai, verbose);
00633         break;
00634       case NMT_JEWEL:
00635         snprint_nfc_jewel_info(dst + off, size - off, &pnt->nti.nji, verbose);
00636         break;
00637       case NMT_FELICA:
00638         snprint_nfc_felica_info(dst + off, size - off, &pnt->nti.nfi, verbose);
00639         break;
00640       case NMT_ISO14443B:
00641         snprint_nfc_iso14443b_info(dst + off, size - off, &pnt->nti.nbi, verbose);
00642         break;
00643       case NMT_ISO14443BI:
00644         snprint_nfc_iso14443bi_info(dst + off, size - off, &pnt->nti.nii, verbose);
00645         break;
00646       case NMT_ISO14443B2SR:
00647         snprint_nfc_iso14443b2sr_info(dst + off, size - off, &pnt->nti.nsi, verbose);
00648         break;
00649       case NMT_ISO14443B2CT:
00650         snprint_nfc_iso14443b2ct_info(dst + off, size - off, &pnt->nti.nci, verbose);
00651         break;
00652       case NMT_DEP:
00653         snprint_nfc_dep_info(dst + off, size - off, &pnt->nti.ndi, verbose);
00654         break;
00655     }
00656   }
00657 }
